metadata.title: CVE-2017-7494 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
Samba since version 3.5.0 and before 4.6.4, 4.5.10 and 4.4.14 is vulnerableto remote code execution vulnerability, allowing a malicious client toupload a shared library to a writable share, and then cause the server toload and execute it.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.8
libpam-smbpass - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.8
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.8
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.8
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.8
libsmbsharemodes0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.8
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.8
python-samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.8
registry-tools - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.8
samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.8
samba-common - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.8
samba-common-bin - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.8
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.8
samba-libs - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.8
samba-testsuite - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.8
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.8
smbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.8
winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.8').
